author: Special Correspondent
text:
After having warned political parties not to carry “political messages” like photographs of their leaders and party symbols on their vehicles, Madurai Rural District police have started seizing those vehicles violating the norms.

Superintendent of Police Vijayendra Bidari said that the seizure of vehicles began on Friday. An SUV of V. Dhanasekaran, Vadipatti town secretary of Amma Peravai, was seized on Friday as it had the photograph of party general secretary and Chief Minister Jayalalithaa. On Sunday, the vehicle of Marumalarchi Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam functionary Anitha Paulraj was seized on the same charge.

The SP said that the photographs and other political messages on the vehicles amounted to campaigning for the party.

However, he said that no seizure of vehicle was made for the vehicle sporting party flags, since the election campaign has started. “We have asked the owners to remove such flags. However, stringent action will be taken against the vehicles if they were found to be campaigning with flags,” he said.

The district police have so far, seized 1,821 bottles of IMFL, worth Rs. 1.64 lakh, that were sold illegally. Similarly, Rs. 27.24 lakh has been seized from various places for want of proper accounts. Eighty gas stoves that were kept for distribution under Union Government’s welfare scheme (in Keezhavalavu), gift packs of 58 torch lights and five irons (Elumalai) were also among the seized items.
title: Cars with photographs of leaders, party symbols seized
